seller_statement: How does this whole process actually work?
response: Great question — it’s simpler than most people expect. We walk you through a quick assessment of your home, present an offer based on local comps and condition, and if you accept, we handle everything from paperwork to closing.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help if I walked you through the timeline from offer to close step-by-step?

seller_statement: Why can't you just buy it yourself if you're making an offer?
response: That’s totally fair to ask. The way we work is by partnering with vetted buyers we trust, which allows us to tailor the offer to fit your timeline and condition. It keeps things simple and gives you more flexibility.
follow_up_prompt: Would you like me to explain how that benefits you and avoids delays?

seller_statement: There’s just too much going on right now to make this decision.
response: I completely understand — life doesn’t pause just because you’re thinking about selling. My goal is to make this one thing a little easier for you, not add more pressure.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help to just get the offer info now and check back in when timing is better?

seller_statement: The house is fine — doesn’t need anything at all.
response: That’s great to hear — it’s always easier when homes are already in solid shape. That said, most investors will still make updates to match what buyers expect in today’s market.
follow_up_prompt: Would it be okay if I asked a couple quick questions to make sure we’re seeing it the same way?

seller_statement: My Realtor said I could get way more than that.
response: That makes sense — agents aim for top dollar in a retail setting. We look at the home from an investor’s lens, factoring in repairs, fees, and how fast it can resell. Both paths have pros and cons.
follow_up_prompt: Would it help to break down what you’d net each route so you can compare apples to apples?

seller_statement: I don’t want to haggle — just give me your best number.
response: Absolutely. I want this to be clean and fair. I just need to make sure I’ve got the full picture before locking in the number, so it’s accurate the first time.
follow_up_prompt: Can I confirm a few quick things so I don’t miss anything important?

seller_statement: This was my parents’ house — lots of memories here.
response: I appreciate you sharing that. Homes hold a lot more than bricks and paint — they hold people, stories, and meaning. We’ll treat that with respect.
follow_up_prompt: Is there anything you’d want to make sure is handled a certain way if we move forward?

seller_statement: I don’t really want to be contacted unless you have something serious.
response: I get that — no one wants to be bombarded. I’ll keep it short and only reach out if we have a concrete update or a real offer.
follow_up_prompt: Would text or email be better just in case something changes?

seller_statement: I’ve already gotten 10 offers — this is overwhelming.
response: Totally understand — this process shouldn’t feel like a full-time job. I can walk you through what matters most and help you cut through the noise so it’s easier to decide.
follow_up_prompt: Do you want a quick breakdown of how we stack up next to the rest?
